sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Hey, I’m Jihad Al Sayed, and in this lesson, we’re going to break down the inverse of a matrix — how to find it, when it exists, and why it’s so useful in solving systems and more.

sections.title: What Is the Inverse of a Matrix?
sections.content: If A is a square matrix and there's a matrix A⁻¹ such that A · A⁻¹ = I, then A⁻¹ is called the inverse of A. It acts like division in matrix algebra.

sections.title: Example: Inverse of a 2x2 Matrix
sections.math: A = \begin{bmatrix}a & b \\ c & d\end{bmatrix} \Rightarrow A^{-1} = \frac{1}{ad - bc} \begin{bmatrix}d & -b \\ -c & a\end{bmatrix}

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We defined what the inverse of a matrix is, how to compute it for 2x2 cases, when it exists, and how it's used to solve systems of equations. A powerful concept for control systems, optimization, and more.
